p: Bed bugs were obtained from a colony maintained at 25 °C, 70 ± 5% relative humidity, and a photoperiod of 12:12 h (light:dark) [ 2]. This colony was originally established from bed bugs collected in an apartment in Jersey City, NJ, USA in 2008. Insects were fed in the laboratory through a parafilm membrane feeder with defibrinated rabbit blood heated to 37 °C by a circulating water bath [ 39]. Experimental insects were tested unfed, 7 days after adult emergence.
